title: Parallel Paths for Space Sustainability
summary: The United States' announcement of a ban on destructive ASAT tests set the stage for a UN meeting on reducing space threats.

title: OneWeb to resume launches in fourth quarter
summary: OneWeb, the broadband megaconstellation company whose launch plans were disrupted by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, expects to resume launches late this year, an executive said June 23.

title: NASA Sets Live Launch Coverage for CAPSTONE Mission to Moon
summary: NASA will air live launch coverage of the agency’s Cislunar Autonomous Positioning System Technology Operations and Navigation Experiment (CAPSTONE), the first spacecraft to fly a specific unique lunar orbit ahead of future missions with crew.

title: NASA Mars Orbiter Releasing One of Its Last Rainbow-Colored Maps
summary: The map, to be released in batches over six months, covers the vast majority of the planet, revealing dozens of minerals found on its surface.

title: SatixFy names CEO to lead its public company transformation
summary: SatixFy named David Ripstein as CEO June 23 to lead the satcoms equipment maker’s planned transformation into a public company.

title: Hughes and OneWeb deploy high-speed internet for U.S. military at remote Arctic base
summary: A Hughes-OneWeb prototype network at Thule, Greenland, is fast enough to enable video conferencing, streaming video and interactive games.

title: First Ariane 5 flight of 2022 launches two satellites for Asia-Pacific
summary: Arianespace launched a pair of satellites aiming to improve broadband coverage in the Asia-Pacific region June 22 on the Ariane 5 rocket’s first flight of the year.

title: Second segment added to Starship launch tower at Kennedy Space Center
summary: The second section of the Florida launch tower for SpaceX’s huge Super Heavy and Starship rocket was lifted on top of the first tower segment Thursday at the Kennedy Space Center, continuing construction of a structure that will stand more than 400 feet tall.

title: Microsoft, Xplore and NOAA demonstrate cloud-based satellite operations
summary: Over the last year, Microsoft and Xplore worked with the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to show how commercial services could support operations of polar-orbiting weather satellites.

title: Office of Space Commerce on a “listening tour” for civil space traffic management
summary: The new head of the Office of Space Commerce says he’s talking with industry on how his office can best take over civil space traffic management while also potentially taking on more regulatory responsibilities.
